trans-unit.source: Returns the size in bytes of a given directory.

seg-source.mrk: Returns the size in bytes of a given directory.

target.mrk: Returns the size in bytes of a given directory.

trans-unit.source: The directory path to get the size from, e.g. "C:\Windows".

seg-source.mrk: The directory path to get the size from, e.g.

target.mrk: The directory path to get the size from, e.g.

trans-unit.source: [optional] this flag determines the behaviour and result of the function, and can be a combination of the following:

seg-source.mrk: this flag determines the behaviour and result of the function, and can be a combination of the following:

target.mrk: this flag determines the behaviour and result of the function, and can be a combination of the following:

trans-unit.source: $DIR_EXTENDED (1) = Extended mode is On -> returns an array that contains extended information (see Remarks).

seg-source.mrk: $DIR_EXTENDED (1) = Extended mode is On -> returns an array that contains extended information (see Remarks).

target.mrk: $DIR_EXTENDED (1) = Extended mode is On -> returns an array that contains extended information (see Remarks).

trans-unit.source: $DIR_NORECURSE (2) = Don't get the size of files in subdirectories (recursive mode is Off)

seg-source.mrk: $DIR_NORECURSE (2) = Don't get the size of files in subdirectories (recursive mode is Off)

target.mrk: $DIR_NORECURSE (2) = Don't get the size of files in subdirectories (recursive mode is Off)

trans-unit.source: the sizes that are greater than or equal to zero

seg-source.mrk: the sizes that are greater than or equal to zero

target.mrk: the sizes that are greater than or equal to zero

trans-unit.source: -1 and sets the @error flag to non-zero if the path doesn't exist.

seg-source.mrk: -1 and sets the @error flag to non-zero if the path doesn't exist.

target.mrk: -1 and sets the @error flag to non-zero if the path doesn't exist.
